org.bytedeco.nvcodec.nvencodeapi

Class NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.nvcodec.nvencodeapi.NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Properties(inherit=nvencodeapi.class)
public class NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264
extends Pointer
    \struct _NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 H264 specific enc pic params. sent on a per frame basis.

      int seiPayloadArrayCnt()
      [in]: Specifies the number of elements allocated in seiPayloadArray array.
      NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 seiPayloadArrayCnt(int setter) 
      int sliceMode()
      [in]: This parameter in conjunction with sliceModeData specifies the way in which the picture is divided into slices sliceMode = 0 MB based slices, sliceMode = 1 Byte based slices, sliceMode = 2 MB row based slices, sliceMode = 3, numSlices in Picture When forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt is set it will have priority over sliceMode setting When sliceMode == 0 and sliceModeData == 0 whole picture will be coded with one slice
      NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 sliceMode(int setter) 
      int sliceModeData()
      [in]: Specifies the parameter needed for sliceMode.
      NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 sliceModeData(int setter) 
      int sliceModeDataUpdate()
      [in]: Set to 1 if client wants to change the sliceModeData field to specify new sliceSize Parameter When forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt is set it will have priority over sliceMode setting
      NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 sliceModeDataUpdate(int setter)

      • forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
public int forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt()
        [in]: Forces an intra refresh with duration equal to intraRefreshFrameCnt. When outputRecoveryPointSEI is set this is value is used for recovery_frame_cnt in recovery point SEI message forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt cannot be used if B frames are used in the GOP structure specified

      • forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt(int setter)

      • constrainedFrame

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
 @NoOffset
public int constrainedFrame()
        [in]: Set to 1 if client wants to encode this frame with each slice completely independent of other slices in the frame. NV_ENC_INITIALIZE_PARAMS::enableConstrainedEncoding should be set to 1

      • constrainedFrame

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 constrainedFrame(int setter)

      • sliceModeDataUpdate

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
 @NoOffset
public int sliceModeDataUpdate()
        [in]: Set to 1 if client wants to change the sliceModeData field to specify new sliceSize Parameter When forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt is set it will have priority over sliceMode setting

      • sliceModeDataUpdate

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 sliceModeDataUpdate(int setter)

      • sliceMode

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
public int sliceMode()
        [in]: This parameter in conjunction with sliceModeData specifies the way in which the picture is divided into slices sliceMode = 0 MB based slices, sliceMode = 1 Byte based slices, sliceMode = 2 MB row based slices, sliceMode = 3, numSlices in Picture When forceIntraRefreshWithFrameCnt is set it will have priority over sliceMode setting When sliceMode == 0 and sliceModeData == 0 whole picture will be coded with one slice

      • sliceMode

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 sliceMode(int setter)

      • sliceModeData

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
public int sliceModeData()
        [in]: Specifies the parameter needed for sliceMode. For: sliceMode = 0, sliceModeData specifies # of MBs in each slice (except last slice) sliceMode = 1, sliceModeData specifies maximum # of bytes in each slice (except last slice) sliceMode = 2, sliceModeData specifies # of MB rows in each slice (except last slice) sliceMode = 3, sliceModeData specifies number of slices in the picture. Driver will divide picture into slices optimally

      • sliceModeData

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 sliceModeData(int setter)

      • ltrMarkFrameIdx

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
public int ltrMarkFrameIdx()

      • ltrMarkFrameIdx

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 ltrMarkFrameIdx(int setter)

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
public int ltrUsageMode()
        [in]: Not supported. Reserved for future use and must be set to 0.

      • forceIntraSliceCount

        @Cast(value="uint32_t")
public int forceIntraSliceCount()
        [in]: Specifies the number of slices to be forced to Intra in the current picture. This option along with forceIntraSliceIdx[] array needs to be used with sliceMode = 3 only

      • forceIntraSliceCount

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 forceIntraSliceCount(int setter)

      • forceIntraSliceIdx

        @Cast(value="uint32_t*")
public IntPointer forceIntraSliceIdx()
        [in]: Slice indices to be forced to intra in the current picture. Each slice index should be <= num_slices_in_picture -1. Index starts from 0 for first slice. The number of entries in this array should be equal to forceIntraSliceCount

      • forceIntraSliceIdx

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 forceIntraSliceIdx(IntPointer setter)

        @ByRef
public NV_ENC_TIME_CODE timeCode()
        [in]: Specifies the clock timestamp sets used in picture timing SEI. Applicable only when NV_ENC_CONFIG_H264::enableTimeCode is set to 1.

      • timeCode

        public NV_ENC_PIC_PARAMS_H264 timeCode(NV_ENC_TIME_CODE setter)
